title: GDP per Capita To GII Comparison

content.question:
COUNTRY COMPARISON

Country 
Gender Inequality Index 
GDP per Capita (United States dollars) 

Spain 
0.080 
28,157 

Kuwait 
0.270 
29,040 

Sources: United Nations Development Programme, World Bank

Which of the following statements is most consistent with the data shown in the table?

choices.label: There are a large number of women in the Spanish legislature, but few women have been elected in Kuwait.
Spain and Kuwait are countries that have very similar levels of economic and social development.
An increase in per capita wealth will almost always result in an improvement in gender equity in a country.
Spain and Kuwait are countries that have very different levels of economic development.
There is a close correlation between the two statistics displayed on the chart above.

content.answer: There are a large number of women in the Spanish legislature, but few women have been elected in Kuwait.

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Compare patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
